camel.sink.endpoint.nodes.name: camel.sink.endpoint.nodes
camel.sink.endpoint.nodes.description: The address of the nodes composing the cluster.

camel.sink.endpoint.resultHeader.name: camel.sink.endpoint.resultHeader
camel.sink.endpoint.resultHeader.description: The header that wil carry the result.

camel.sink.endpoint.transportClassName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transportClassName
camel.sink.endpoint.transportClassName.description: The class name (fqn) of the Atomix transport

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultResourceConfi.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultResourceConfig
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultResourceConfi.description: The cluster wide default resource configuration.

camel.sink.endpoint.ephemeral.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ephemeral
camel.sink.endpoint.ephemeral.description: Sets if the local member should join groups as PersistentMember or not. If set to ephemeral the local member will receive an auto generated ID thus the local one is ignored.

camel.sink.endpoint.readConsistency.name: camel.sink.endpoint.readConsistency
camel.sink.endpoint.readConsistency.description: The read consistency level. One of: [ATOMIC] [ATOMIC_LEASE] [SEQUENTIAL] [LOCAL]

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.atomix-messaging.configu.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.configurationUri
camel.component.atomix-messaging.configu.description: The path to the AtomixClient configuration

camel.component.atomix-messaging.nodes.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.nodes
camel.component.atomix-messaging.nodes.description: The nodes the AtomixClient should connect to

camel.component.atomix-messaging.resultH.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.resultHeader
camel.component.atomix-messaging.resultH.description: The header that wil carry the result.

camel.component.atomix-messaging.transpo.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.transportClassName
camel.component.atomix-messaging.transpo.description: The class name (fqn) of the Atomix transport

camel.component.atomix-messaging.lazySta.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.atomix-messaging.lazySta.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.atomix-messaging.autowir.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.atomix-messaging.autowir.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.atomix-messaging.default.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.defaultResourceConfig
camel.component.atomix-messaging.default.description: The cluster wide default resource configuration.

camel.component.atomix-messaging.ephemer.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.ephemeral
camel.component.atomix-messaging.ephemer.description: Sets if the local member should join groups as PersistentMember or not. If set to ephemeral the local member will receive an auto generated ID thus the local one is ignored.

camel.component.atomix-messaging.readCon.name: camel.component.atomix-messaging.readConsistency
camel.component.atomix-messaging.readCon.description: The read consistency level. One of: [ATOMIC] [ATOMIC_LEASE] [SEQUENTIAL] [LOCAL]
